titles.title: Human Rights Commission Act of 2007
To establish a United States Human Rights Commission to monitor compliance by the United States with international human rights treaty obligations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 5/14/2008--Introduced. Human Rights Commission Act of 2007 [sic] - Establishes the Human Rights Commission which shall monitor U.S. compliance with all international human rights treaties to which the United States is a party (including treaties to which the United States becomes a party after the date of the enactment of this Act).
